text: (bright music)
- We focus on full-stack observability
with a business perspective,
to help people understand
how their solutions and their software

are impacting their business
and their customers.
We needed a solution that would allow us
to scale and ramp fast,

especially, a lot of our
customers are retail,

and so there's seasonality
and different things,
and so we needed to be able to expand
and grow with our customers and make sure
that performance is always optimal.

We were just looking for
a place, essentially,

to host our controllers
in the SaaS environment.
So we built this out using containers,
and we took, we've got probably 25

different technologies
that we interact with
and integrate with, that AWS offers.

And it's really been a
good solution for us,

to be able to focus on
building the software,

and not so much have to
worry about the architecture
and everything that's going on there,

'cause there's so many
available solutions to us.
It's so easy to get set up and run,
and we don't have to worry so much
about managing and monitoring.
We're building out these extensible
collectors to pull data in,

and really, not only take
advantage of it for ourselves,
but use that data for our customers
who are hosted on AWS,

to take all of the information
available from AWS,

add it to what we have
inside of the application,

and really give that
full-stack visibility.

We have the confidence to know
that as we go down the road

and we continue to grow
our cloud-native offerings,
AWS is gonna be right there supporting us.
